class="mb-2">After installing Python 3.8 or above, install Harlequin using <code class="whitespace-nowrap bg-pink px-1 py-0.5 text-sm">pip</code> or <code class="whitespace-nowrap bg-pink px-1 py-0.5 select-none" data-svelte-h="svelte-134xyv7">$ </span>pipx install harlequin</pre> <h2 class="mt-8 font-accent text-2xl">Using Harlequin</h2> <p class="mb-2">From any shell, to open one or more DuckDB database files:</p> <pre class="my-1 w-full overflow-x-auto rounded border border-purple bg-pink selection:bg-purple px-4 py-4 text-sm svelte-1494as7"><span class="text-purple font-bold select-none" data-svelte-h="svelte-134xyv7">$ </span>harlequin &quot;path/to/duck.db&quot; &quot;another_duck.db&quot;</pre> <p class="mb-2">To open an in-memory DuckDB session, run Harlequin with no arguments:</p> <pre class="my-1 w-full overflow-x-auto rounded border border-purple bg-pink selection:bg-purple px-4 py-4 text-sm svelte-1494as7"><span class="text-purple font-bold select-none" data-svelte-h="svelte-134xyv7">$ </span>harlequin</pre> <p class="mb-2">You can also open a database in read-only mode:</p> <pre class="my-1 w-full overflow-x-auto rounded border border-purple bg-pink selection:bg-purple px-4 py-4 text-sm svelte-1494as7"><span class="text-purple font-bold select-none" data-svelte-h="svelte-134xyv7">$ </span>harlequin -r &quot;path/to/duck.db&quot;</pre> <h2 class="mt-8 font-accent text-2xl">Getting Help</h2> <p class="mb-2">To view all command-line options for Harlequin, after installation, simply type:</p> <pre class="my-1 w-full overflow-x-auto rounded border border-purple bg-pink selection:bg-purple px-4 py-4 text-sm svelte-1494as7"><span class="text-purple font-bold select-none" data-svelte-h="svelte-134xyv7">$ </span>harlequin -h</pre> <p class="mb-2">To view a list of all key bindings (keyboard shortcuts) within the app, press <kbd class="rounded border-b-2 border-r-2 border-purple bg-pink px-2 py-1 text-xs font-bold">F1</kbd>.
